Thermodynamics¶

Contains functions for computing thermodynamic data.

ising.thermo.partition(hamilt, length[, temp = 298.15, boltzmann = BOLTZMANN_K])¶

Find the value of the partition function.

Parameters

  • hamilt (ising.hamiltonian.Hamiltonian) – ising.hamiltonian.Hamiltonian object.

  • length (int) – The number of positions in the Ising system.

  • temp (float) – The temperature to compute the partition function for. Defaults to 298.15 K.

  • boltzmann (float) – The value of the Boltzmann constant. Defaults to ising.constants.BOLTZMANN_K.

Returns

The value of the partition function.

ising.thermo.average_value(func, hamilt, length[, temp = 298.15, boltzmann = BOLTZMANN_K])¶

Find the average value of a property, weighted by the Boltzmann parameters.

Parameters

  • func (function(ising.spins.SpinConfig, *args, **kwargs)) – Function that takes a SpinConfig as its first argument.

  • hamilt (ising.hamiltonian.Hamiltonian) – ising.hamiltonian.Hamiltonian object.

  • length (int) – The number of positions in the Ising system.

  • temp (float) – The temperature to compute the partition function for. Defaults to 298.15 K.

  • boltzmann (float) – The value of the Boltzmann constant. Defaults to ising.constants.BOLTZMANN_K.

Returns

The average value of a property.

ising.thermo.variance(func, hamilt, length[, temp = 298.15, boltzmann = BOLTZMANN_K])¶

Find the variance of a property, weighted by the Boltzmann parameters.

Parameters

  • func (function(ising.spins.SpinConfig, *args, **kwargs)) – Function that takes a ising.spins.SpinConfig as its first argument.

  • hamilt (ising.hamiltonian.Hamiltonian) – ising.hamiltonian.Hamiltonian object.

  • length (int) – The number of positions in the Ising system.

  • temp (float) – The temperature to compute the partition function for. Defaults to 298.15 K.

  • boltzmann (float) – The value of the Boltzmann constant. Defaults to ising.constants.BOLTZMANN_K.

Returns

The variance of a property.
